heroDescription: Design, usability, AI, and data to create useful and scalable digital experiences.
geomitesCardDescription: Design and development of an indie video game that combines exploration, adventure, and decision-making mechanics.
artisteoCardDescription: Product design and strategic definition of a marketplace that connects musical artists with their audience and facilitates professional opportunities.
vivagymCardDescription: Strategic redesign of the VivaGym app to increase retention and use of key features, boosting user engagement.
cardFreelanceSenzoStudioDescription: Design and development of the website for a visual effects studio, with a minimalist and powerful visual focus.
cardFreelanceMenarteDescription: Creation of the website for a catering equipment rental company, with an accessible catalog and a clear structure.
cardFreelanceElevaDescription: Design and development of the website for an online training company, with a modular structure and a functional approach.
myHistoryOne: My journey began in marketing, where I discovered the value of strategy, communication, and a deep understanding of people. Over time, that curiosity about how things work evolved into product design, a space where creativity meets logic and ideas are transformed into real experiences.
myHistoryTwo: For me, design is a constant learning process: observing, testing, and improving to transform complexity into clarity. I have learned that good design goes beyond aesthetics; it is about making technology useful, accessible, and, above all, human.
myHistoryThree: Today, I focus my work on designing data-driven digital products powered by artificial intelligence. I seek to help companies connect more deeply with the people they serve. Each project represents an opportunity to make intelligence visible through design that solves problems and generates value.
article1Description: User interviews allow us to understand real needs, behaviors, and motivations. They help in detecting problems, validating ideas, and finding opportunities. Their success depends on preparing questions well, keeping them open, and listening without prejudice.
article2Description: Stakeholder interviews help align expectations, understand priorities, and detect restrictions from the start. They offer a strategic vision that complements the user's perspective. Listening and translating their goals into design decisions is key.
cardExperienceOneDescription: I design and launch digital products for growing businesses, blending usability, data, and strategy to drive conversion. I lead UX research, define user flows, and create scalable design systems that align with business goals. My work streamlines iteration and enhances activation metrics in MVP products.
cardExperienceTwoDescription: I led digital strategy and user acquisition initiatives, redesigning web experiences and touchpoints through behavioral insights. By applying A/B testing and audience segmentation, I optimized conversion and strengthened the alignment between digital communication and business goals.
cardEducationTwoTitle: UI pattern design for successful software
cardEducationFourTitle: Emotional design: How to create products that
cardEducationFiveTitle: Design for the 21st century with Don Norman
cardTestimonyDescriptionDiego: Working with Alejandro is always easy. He quickly understands what you need and knows how to unite the user's vision with the project's goals. He also contributes useful ideas and has no problem iterating until everything fits.
cardTestimonyDescriptionMarc: What I like most about working with Alejandro is that he gets straight to the point. He truly listens, proposes with empathy, and always looks for the best way to add value to the product without forgetting deadlines.
cardTestimonyDescriptionRuben: Alejandro knows how to bring his designs to reality without losing the initial idea. He communicates clearly with the technical team, which makes development flow much more smoothly.
cardTestimonyDescriptionAlvaro: Alejandro has a very sharp eye for seeing improvements that others overlook. He combines sensitivity towards people with attention to detail, so his proposals always have a solid foundation.
cardTestimonyDescriptionLluis: Working with Alejandro has been very inspiring. He has a simple and functional approach, but always adds a creative touch. He thinks about the whole experience, not just how it looks.
cardReadingElCamino01Description: A practical guide to growing in your career as a designer.
cardReadingEjerciciosResueltos02Descript: Practice your design skills and prepare for your next career level-up.
cardReadingModelosMentales03Description: 30 practical and applicable guidelines to think more strategically when designing
cardReadingComoSe04Description: Congratulations, you're a manager!: you don't really know what you're doing.
cardReadingElDiseñoDe05Description: What happens when you've created a great website or app and want it to
cardReadingElDiseño06Description: One of the world's great designers shares his vision of products and their designs.
cardReadingNoMe07Description: Steve Krug's guide will help you understand the principles of usability.
cardReadingAboutFace08Description: The essential guide to interaction design, fully revised and updated.
cardReadingEnganchado09Description: A four-step process companies use to create and develop their products.
cardReadingDiseñoIntuitivo10Description: Eight steps for an intuitive user interface and the guidelines to implement it.
projectInfoDescriptionThree: Market research, sketching, user testing, data validation, UX design.
projectInfoDescriptionFour: Figma, Notion, Miro, Adobe Illustrator, Jira.
projectInfoDescriptionSixOne: Geomites is an indie mobile game that mixes exploration, creature collection, and a colorful geological setting. Its goal is to offer an accessible and attractive experience for casual players, combining light narrative and simple mechanics.
projectInfoDescriptionSixTwo: The project emerged as a personal initiative to apply UX design in the gaming field. I was in charge of the entire process: from the initial idea to visual design, mechanics, and user validation.
projectInfoDescriptionSixThree: This case allowed me to explore how to apply user-centered design principles in a playful environment, facing challenges such as visual clarity, usability, and player progression.
geomitesSectionObjectivesDescription: To build a solid product, we needed to understand both our players and the market. This phase was divided into two fronts: internal data analysis and competitive analysis.
cardObjectivesOneTitle: Consolidate a coherent and scalable visual identity
cardObjectivesOneDescription: Create a reusable design system that allows for maintaining the visual coherence of the game and its communication in future digital media (game, networks, marketing, etc.).
cardObjectivesTwoTitle: Measurement and improvement of key metrics (KPI's)
cardObjectivesTwoDescription: Design and launch a functional landing page to validate concept, visual style, and narrative. We analyzed metrics such as conversion, content discovery, and retention to iterate on improvements.
geomitesSectionDescriptionTwo: We combined real data and market study to make informed decisions, detect opportunities, and reduce uncertainty in design.
geomitesDataAnalysisDescription: With the game live, we implemented key metrics such as retention, average session time, and abandonment points. This data helped us identify friction, validate hypotheses, and guide improvements in the user experience.
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionOneDescrip: Percentage of users who complete relevant actions (profile creation, tutorial completion, first battle...).
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionTwoDescrip: Percentage of users who interact with non-mandatory secondary or exploratory content (customization menu, training geomite, crafting item).
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionThreeDescr: This KPI measures Geomites' ability to keep users active for a specific period of time.
geomitesMarketAnalysisDescription: Before making any design decisions, it is crucial to understand the market context, user expectations, and current references. Prior research allows us to design from knowledge, not from assumption.
geomitesGameOneDescription: It combines card collection (champions and spells) with a progression based on levels and rarities, where the player is motivated to collect, upgrade, and customize their battle deck.
geomitesGameTwoDescription: It features a vertical wave-based combat system, where players form a team of champions that fight automatically against enemies. The strategy lies in the placement, choice, and upgrade of the champions.
geomitesSectionDescriptionThree: From data analysis and the market context, we identified key opportunities to improve the player's experience. This section covers the design decisions we implemented to optimize navigation, increase conversion at key moments, and strengthen retention.
geomitesDesignDecisionsOneDescription: The interface visually highlighted the first key actions (tutorial, first battle) and organized navigation for a clear onboarding.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneD: Initial friction was reduced, early retention improved, and player continuity increased.
geomitesDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: A design system with reusable components and a style guide was created, applying atomic design principles to ensure coherence and flexibility.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoD: It allowed for faster product scaling, reduced design and development costs, and maintained a consistent visual identity across all screens.
geomitesDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: The interface organized content in progressive layers with visual indicators, applying a 'visible unlock' logic to anticipate what's to come without overwhelming the player.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThre: Motivation and engagement were increased, favoring longer sessions and greater player retention.
geomitesDesignDecisionsFourDescription: Microinteractions, soft animations, and positive messages that reinforce player milestones in a non-intrusive way were implemented.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFour: User satisfaction and motivation improved, boosting retention and increasing the likelihood of returning to the game.
geomitesSectionDescriptionFour: To quickly iterate and develop the MVP, I created a compact design system, coherent with Geomites' retro-modern style. This system ensures visual consistency, facilitates collaboration with development, and is scalable for future improvements, optimizing both the user experience and the design process.
geomitesSubSectionOneDescriptionFour: In Geomites, the combination of a legible typography and careful wording contributes to an accessible and attractive experience. The Grenze font family reinforces the game's visual identity, while a clear and close language facilitates navigation and improves gameplay understanding.
geomitesSubSectionTwoDescriptionFour: The color palette in Geomites has been strategically reduced to prioritize functionality and accessibility. Each tone has been selected with intention, ensuring its use provides visual clarity and reinforces the user experience.
geomitesSubSectionThreeDescriptionFour: We designed and refined our own icons to give the game a unique visual identity. This personalization not only reinforces aesthetic coherence but also helps players immerse themselves more deeply in the Geomites universe.
geomitesSubSectionFourDescriptionFour: The design system includes a component library that allows us to standardize and provide greater visual coherence for an immersive user experience. It also allows us to make quick adjustments to the configuration of game components.
geomitesSectionDescriptionFive: Thanks to continuous measurement and the application of data-driven design decisions, we observed significant improvements in three key metrics: conversion on important actions, content discovery, and user retention.
geomitesImproveFrameOneDescription: Ensure that users receive clear and attractive guidance during the onboarding process, clearly showing them how to complete the main actions and encouraging them to move forward with positive and personalized messages.
geomitesImproveFrameTwoDescription: Introduce rewards or challenges to incentivize users to explore additional content.
geomitesImproveFrameThreeDescription: Introduce a system of daily rewards or long-term achievement bonuses that motivate users to return.
geomitesSectionDescriptionSix: Geomites allowed me to strengthen a user-centered and data-driven design approach, learning to iterate with good judgment and balance creativity with product goals.
geomitesSectionDescriptionSeven: Geomites was developed in collaboration with a small technical and creative team. Working side-by-side with them allowed me to align design, development, and product vision in an agile and coherent way.
geomitesSectionDescriptionEight: Geomites is one of several projects where I apply strategic design and an analytical approach. Feel free to take a look and explore others I have worked on.
artisteoInfoDescriptionThree: Market research, user personas and flows, wireframes (low and high fidelity), prototyping, and development support.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixOne: Artisteo is a marketplace that connects musical artists with people looking for music professionals for events, concerts, and other job opportunities.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixTwo: One of the project's main objectives is to offer a solution that artists could start using quickly and easily, allowing us to launch a first functional version of the product (MVP) and, from there, iterate based on the knowledge and feedback obtained from the users themselves.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixThree: My role as a product designer is key to defining an accessible experience from the first use, structuring clear flows, and collaborating closely with the development team to ensure the technical viability of each decision.
artisteoSectionTitleOneFirstParagraph: In a sector as competitive as music, many emerging artists face significant barriers to accessing professional opportunities. At the same time, promoters, venues, and event organizers need a simple way to discover and hire talent without intermediaries or complicated processes.
artisteoSectionTitleOneSecondParagraph: Artisteo was created as a digital platform that responds to this dual need: to connect musical artists with contractors in a direct, agile, and secure way.
artisteoSectionTitleOneThirdParagraph: The project was developed over a period of two months, with a practical and user-centered approach, prioritizing the delivery of a first functional version that would allow the proposal to be validated as soon as possible.
artisteoSectionObjectivesDescription: The Artisteo project was created with the intention of transforming how musical artists and contractors connect and collaborate. To do this, three key objectives were established to guide the entire development.
artisteoCardObjectivesOneTitle: Facilitate the hiring of musical artists
artisteoCardObjectivesOneDescription: Create a platform that connects musicians directly with contractors (event organizers, bars, festivals), eliminating intermediate barriers and making the search and hiring process more simple, fast, and transparent.
artisteoCardObjectivesTwoTitle: Launch a functional version as soon as possible (MVP)
artisteoCardObjectivesTwoDescription: Develop a minimum viable product that artists can start using from the very first moment, with the essential functionalities to validate it in a real environment and obtain valuable insights from the start.
artisteoCardObjectivesThreeTitle: Iterate the product based on real use and feedback
artisteoCardObjectivesThreeDescription: Design the system with a flexible architecture that allows it to evolve easily based on learnings, real user needs, and opportunities detected once the product is in operation.
artisteoSectionResearchDescription: To design a useful, viable, and desirable solution, I focused the research phase from two complementary perspectives: on one hand, market analysis, focused on understanding how the most successful marketplaces work; on the other, research with real users, divided into two key groups: music professionals and contractors.
artisteoDataAnalysisDescription: I studied several of the most established marketplaces in the sector (such as Fiverr, Skool, GigSalad, or Encore), analyzing key aspects of their functionality and success:
artisteoDataAnalysisPointOne: User acquisition strategies: how they generate trust and visibility for both parties (for example, through reviews, verified profiles, or payment guarantees).
artisteoDataAnalysisPointTwo: Service structure: how they present the offer, what filters and categories allow for an effective search, and how they facilitate contact or hiring.
artisteoDataAnalysisPointThree: Differentiated value proposition: what makes them stand out (in some cases, the community; in others, ease of use or specialization).
artisteoGameOneInfoDescription: Scalable and accessible marketplace with a wide global reach.
artisteoGameTwoInfoDescription: Focused on learning and connecting experts and users.
artisteoGameThreeInfoDescription: Hiring artists for events, with a good filtering system.
artisteoGameFourInfoDescription: Professional approach focused on project management.
artisteoUserResearchDescription: Based on the interviews conducted, I defined two representative profiles that helped guide the product design: artist profile and contractor profile. Each one reflects common patterns within its group and allows us to stay focused on real needs throughout the process.
userResearchCardOneHighlight: “I want to make a living from music without depending on informal contacts or favors.”
userResearchCardOneDescription: Lucas is a passionate musician who has worked in bars, weddings, and small festivals. He has a professional style but lacks a digital platform that represents him well. He uses social media to promote himself, but he doesn't manage to convert followers into contracts. He seeks visibility and a serious channel that connects him with real opportunities.
userResearchCardTwoHighlight: “I need reliable musicians who fit each type of event, without having to do endless searches.”
userResearchCardTwoDescription: Ana organizes themed dinners and private celebrations in various venues. She has experience and judgment, but she needs practical solutions. Time is key: she looks for artists who fit the tone of her events, without having to waste hours on social media or asking for recommendations. She values professionalism, punctuality, and good references.
artisteoSectionDesignDecisionsDescriptio: During the development of Artisteo, I made a series of strategic decisions that set the visual and functional direction of the product. Each one responded to specific needs detected in the research and sought to balance the user experience with the project's technical viability.
artisteoDesignDecisionsOneDescription: A quick sign-up flow was designed with minimal data, allowing the profile to be completed progressively.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneD: Friction in registration decreased, increasing the conversion of new users and the creation of active profiles.
artisteoDesignDecisionsTwoTitle: Search engine with filters for contractors
artisteoDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: Filters were added by style, price, event, and availability, along with visible ratings to speed up the search for artists.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoD: It facilitated decision-making, accelerated hiring, and increased user satisfaction.
artisteoDesignDecisionsThreeTitle: Artist profiles focused on trust and talent
artisteoDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: Information was structured with a featured video, verified reviews, a brief description, upcoming events, and quick contact.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThre: It reinforced the credibility of profiles, boosting hiring and generating greater trust in the platform.
artisteoDesignDecisionsFourDescription: Internal messaging was integrated without restrictions to facilitate agile agreements between artists and contractors.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFour: It improved communication, accelerated contract closures, and increased trust in the platform.
artisteoDesignSystemSectionDescription: I focused my time and effort on building a small design system that would guarantee visual consistency, allow for efficient work with development, be scalable, and allow us to continuously improve the design.
artisteoBrandCreationOneDescription: The brand was created to convey professionalism, accessibility, and creativity. The logo, inspired by a triangle that symbolizes artists, contractors, and the organization, is recognizable and adaptable to different sizes and applications.
artisteoBrandCreationTwoDescription: We chose Poppins for its modern, geometric, and highly legible aesthetic, qualities that fit perfectly with the platform's values: clarity, accessibility, and professionalism.
artisteoBrandCreationThreeDescription: This blue-green color palette offers an accessible and modern visual experience, acting as a neutral canvas that favors legibility and gives prominence to content and key interactions.
artisteoBrandCreationFourDescription: The use of standard icons in Artisteo enhances the user experience by being intuitive, accessible, and aesthetically coherent with the product's visual approach.
artisteoBrandCreationFiveDescription: The design system has a component library that ensures visual consistency and allows for quick adjustments. An example is the component with CTA button formats adapted to different design needs.
artisteoLearningsSectionDescription: During the development of Artisteo, I learned to move forward by prototyping, validate quickly to avoid wasting time, and value multidisciplinary collaboration, which enriches the project with different perspectives.
artisteoTeamSectionDescription: We are a multidisciplinary team, made up of development, design, and a commercial area. We work in a coordinated way to build a functional, user-centered platform with a clear value proposition.
artisteoOtherProjectsSectionDescription: Artisteo is a project where I applied strategic design and a user-centered approach to solve real challenges in the music sector. If you want, you can also explore other projects I've worked on.
vivagymInfoDescriptionThree: Internal and external research, problem definition, solution proposal, and prototype design.
vivagymInfoDescriptionFour: Figma, Miro, Google Forms, Chat GPT, Huru.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixOne: After using the VivaGym app for a while, talking with gym members, and conducting a survey of a sample of users, I identified several usage patterns and recurring friction points in the digital experience.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixTwo: From my role as a product designer, I applied a usability analysis and a heuristic analysis in order to detect problems related to accessibility, navigation, and consistency with good design practices.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixThree: Finally, I proposed solutions validated with objective criteria, seeking to generate a positive impact on both the user experience and the value the application brings to the business.
vivagymSectionTitleOneFirstParagraph: The purpose is to improve the digital experience of the VivaGym app, based on active listening to users through surveys and conversations, a comparison with leading fitness apps (Freeletics, Nike Training Club, MyFitnessPal) and gamification apps (Duolingo), and a usability and heuristic analysis.
vivagymSectionObjectivesDescription: After analyzing user behavior and reviewing reference metrics, I defined two main objectives, related to the improvement of the following metrics.
vivagymcardObjectivesOneTitle: Identification of the main usability and experience problems.
vivagymcardObjectivesOneDescription: Based on objective data from surveys and product observation, as well as a comparison with industry leaders.
vivagymcardObjectivesTwoDescription: Aimed at optimizing user navigation, accessibility, and motivation.
vivagymSectionDescriptionThree: Through surveys, usability analysis, heuristic analysis, observation, and understanding of how market leaders deal with these situations, the context and general issues to be addressed are defined.
vivagymSectionResearchFirstDescription: I focused on analyzing four critical flows:
vivagymUsabilityTestFirstValoration: The process is simple, but feedback is limited and the management of full classes is not intuitive.
vivagymUsabilityTestFirstSuggestion: Add waiting lists and clearer feedback when confirming, canceling, or modifying reservations.
vivagymUsabilityTestSecondValoration: The information exists, but it is hidden and not very motivating.
vivagymUsabilityTestSecondSuggestion: Reorganize the section and improve the copywriting to encourage progress tracking.
vivagymUsabilityTestThirdValoration: Management is possible, but with an outdated and unclear design.
vivagymUsabilityTestThirdSuggestion: Modernize the interface and simplify the management of subscriptions and data.
vivagymUsabilityTestFourthValoration: There is no initial guidance or communication of the app's value.
vivagymUsabilityTestFourthSuggestion: Implement a guided onboarding that explains key functions and motivates the first use.
vivagymSectionResearchSecondDescription: I evaluated the app against these 4 key heuristics:
vivagymHeuristicTestFirstValoration: Feedback after actions is insufficient or unclear.
vivagymHeuristicTestFirstSuggestion: Include visible confirmations, alerts, and relevant notifications to keep the user informed.
vivagymHeuristicTestSecondValoration: Lack of visual coherence and consistency in usage patterns.
vivagymHeuristicTestSecondSuggestion: Unify the visual design and flows to align them with recognized standards.
vivagymHeuristicTestThirdValoration: Lack of warning screens and clear error messages.
vivagymHeuristicTestThirdSuggestion: Incorporate preventive alerts and understandable error messages that allow the problem to be easily solved.
vivagymHeuristicTestFivethValoration: It does not adapt to different types of users.
vivagymHeuristicTestFivethSuggestion: Design a more personalized and flexible experience for beginners and advanced users.
vivagymSectionResearchThirdDescription: I conducted a survey of VivaGym members to understand how they perceive the application and what real use they make of it.
vivagymUserInterviewFirstInsightSuggesti: Add useful functionalities (activity tracking, challenges, personalized notifications).
vivagymUserInterviewSecondInsightSuggest: Simplify these sections and incorporate gamification elements.
vivagymSectionResearchFourthDescription: I analyzed leading applications that stand out for their ability to generate engagement and motivation. Among them, I highlighted Strava and Duolingo, whose functionalities can serve as inspiration to improve the VivaGym app.
vivagymSectionDescriptionFour: I transformed the insights obtained into concrete design decisions, aimed at improving the user experience and aligned with the product's key KPIs: increasing usage and adoption, boosting participation, and improving conversion and business.
vivagymDesignDecisionsOneDescription: The main screen is reorganized to clearly display quick access, recommendations, and user status.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneDe: Improves usability and increases interaction with key services.
vivagymDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: A system for recording and visualizing daily and weekly progress is incorporated.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoDe: Encourages retention and recurring use of the app.
vivagymDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: Achievements, challenges, and personalized training sessions are integrated to boost consistency.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThree: Increases retention and promotes social engagement.
vivagymDesignDecisionsFourDescription: Training and nutrition plans are designed to match the user's profile and goals.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFourD: Generates tangible value, loyalty, and higher conversion.
vivagymSectionDescriptionSix: To illustrate how design decisions directly impact the experience, we present one of the main flows, in which the user can generate their training and nutrition plan. This flow shows how the redesign promotes retention, motivation, and personalization, which are strategic pillars of the project.
vivaGymUserFlowsFirstDescription: The “Creating a personalized plan (combined)” flow accompanies the user from the definition of a common goal to the detailed configuration of training and nutrition. It ends with the visualization of the complete plan and a CTA to start directly.
vivagymSectionDescriptionSeven: Throughout the project, I gained valuable lessons that helped me grow as a product designer. These reflections summarize the most relevant aspects that marked the process and that I can apply in future professional challenges.
vivagymMarketFirstDescription: Personalized plans and progress tracking with an engaging visual experience.
vivagymMarketSecondDescription: Keeps users active with streaks, badges, and visible rewards.
vivagymMarketFirstSuggestion: Integrate social dynamics and challenges between VivaGym members.
vivagymDesignSystemDescription: The VivaGym design system is the visual and functional foundation of the application, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and scalability across all flows. Its goal is to unify the user experience and facilitate prototype implementation, guaranteeing that every element supports brand identity and improves usability. This system is organized into four key areas: typography, color, iconography, and components.
vivagymDesignSystemSubSectionOneDescript: The Montserrat typeface has been chosen for its balance between modernity, readability, and versatility. Its geometric design conveys dynamism and approachability, values aligned with VivaGym, while ensuring a clear hierarchy and excellent legibility across different devices. As it is already used by the brand, it reinforces visual coherence and maintains consistency within its identity.
vivagymDesignSystemSubSectionTwoDescript: The color palette is built around the brand's main orange tone, symbolizing energy and vitality. From this, a six-tone scale has been created. This gradation allows flexible application of colors, using lighter tones for backgrounds or secondary elements and darker tones to highlight information or reinforce interaction states.
vivagymDesignSystemSubSectionThreeDescri: The iconography combines standard design elements, which provide immediate recognition and ease navigation, with custom icons designed to bring personality and freshness. This balance offers users an intuitive experience while also delivering differentiation, maintaining a coherent visual style.
vivagymDesignSystemSubSectionFourDescrip: The components were designed in Figma with a modular and adaptable approach. Their structure enables the rapid creation of flows and prototypes, optimizes iterations, and ensures visual consistency throughout the application. This flexibility allows elements such as buttons, cards, or menus to easily adapt to different states and design needs.
vivagymUserFlowOneFirstImageDescription: The user can choose between 3 options: Training plan, nutrition plan, or combined plan.
vivagymUserFlowOneSecondImageDescription: Selection of general parameters and objectives.
vivagymUserFlowOneThirdImageDescription: Preferences: frequency, duration, type of activity, level, and style.
vivagymUserFlowOneFourthImageDescription: Preferences: restrictions, tastes, schedules, and dietary style aligned with the goal.
vivagymUserFlowOneFivethImageDescription: Final view of the combined plan (workouts + meals), with CTA to begin.
vivagymSurveyQuestionOne: “Ignoring QR access, how often do you use the app?”
vivagymSurveyQuestionTwo: “Which features do you use most often?”
vivagymSurveyQuestionThree: “Does the app motivate you to train more often?”
pricesHeroTitle: Web design and development to grow your business.
pricesHeroDescription: I help entrepreneurs and small businesses build a professional digital presence that supports their goals.
pricesInfoDescription: I don't just design and code — I guide you to make your website a real investment. Together, we'll create a tool that reflects your brand and attracts your ideal clients.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardOneSecond: Fast, secure, and mobile-friendly pages. Your online business available on any device.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardTwoSecond: Custom designs that reflect your brand identity and build trust.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardThreeSecond: I explain each step clearly so you always know where we're going.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardFourSecond: I offer solutions tailored to your needs so your website is a real growth tool.
pricesPricesDescription: The prices are indicative. Each business is unique, and I adjust the proposal to your needs.
cardPricesOneThirdIncluded: Responsive design (adapted to mobile, tablet, and computer).
cardPricesOneSixthIncluded: Basic SEO (structure optimized for search engines).
cardPricesTwoDescription: Your custom website for your business.
cardPricesTwoSecondIncluded: Content architecture adapted to your business.
cardPricesThreeFirstIncluded: E-commerce with product management and online payments.
cardPricesThreeSecondIncluded: Booking or advanced integrations (API, CRM, etc.).
pricesFAQsDescription: I'll answer some of the most common questions that people I work with usually have.
cardFAQsTitleOne: What if I don't have technical knowledge?
cardFAQsDescriptionOne: I handle the entire process and deliver a website that's easy to manage. Additionally, I'll explain what's necessary so you can be independent in its use.
cardFAQsTitleTwo: What if I already have a website but it's outdated?
cardFAQsDescriptionTwo: We can redesign it without losing your current information, improving its design, speed, and security to adapt it to current standards.
cardFAQsTitleThree: How long does it take to have the website ready?
cardFAQsDescriptionThree: It depends on the plan and the content, but in most cases, a website can be ready in 3 to 6 weeks.
cardFAQsTitleFour: Do I need to pay a monthly maintenance fee?
cardFAQsDescriptionFour: Not necessarily. I deliver the website ready to function autonomously. If you prefer that I handle updates and support, I can offer you a tailored maintenance plan.
cardFAQsTitleFive: What about the domain and hosting?
cardFAQsDescriptionFive: If you don't have them yet, I'll help you choose and configure the safest and most economical options for your business.
cardFAQsTitleSix: Is the investment really worth it?
cardFAQsDescriptionSix: A professional website isn't an expense; it's an investment. It helps you gain visibility, attract clients, and build trust. Many businesses recover their investment within the first few months.
